subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Wednesday, May 09, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker 

Bush visits Kansas town flattened by
tornado

GREENSBURG, Kansas (CNN) -- Standing
in a muddy lot, President Bush sought to bring comfort to the
residents of tornado-ravaged Greensburg, Kansas, on Wednesday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/09/kansas.bush/index.html

***

White House: New Iraq
bill unacceptable

WASHINGTON (AP) --
President Bush would veto any bill drafted by House Democratic
leaders that would fund the Iraq war only into the summer
months, his spokesman said Wednesday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/white-house-new-iraq-bill-unacceptable.html

***

Blunt slams Dems' new Iraq bill, Pelosi
criticizes veto threat

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
House Minority Whip Roy Blunt, R-Missouri, slammed the
Democrats' two pronged war funding strategy in a session with
reporters Wednesday, calling the new Democratic plan "Act 2 of
the melodrama of whether or not to be in Iraq."

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/blunt-slams-dems-new-iraq-bill-pelosi.html

***

Senate Dems set sights on gas prices

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- When the Democratic-controlled
Senate returns from the Memorial Day recess it will take up
energy legislation aimed at lowering gasoline prices, Senate
Majority Leader Harry Reid, D-Nevada, said Wednesday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/senate-dems-set-sights-on-gas-prices.html

***

Senate leaders talk Iraq with White House
chief of staff

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Senate
Majority Leader Harry Reid, D-Nevada, and Sen. Minority Leader
Mitch McConnell, R Kentucky, met with White House Chief of
Staff Josh Bolten Wednesday morning on Capitol Hill to discuss
the new Iraq supplemental bill.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/senate-leaders-talk-iraq-with-white.html

***

Cheney, in Iraq, senses 'urgency'

BAGHDAD (CNN) -- Vice President Dick Cheney said
Wednesday that he believes there's a "greater sense of urgency"
among Iraqis to generate progress on all fronts in the
war-wracked nation.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/cheney-in-iraq-senses-urgency.html

***

'Bargain' aims to deal with border, then guest
workers

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Senators may have
mended fences on contentious immigration legislation that
sputtered in Congress last year, and they will head into next
week's debate with what one GOP senator called a "grand
bargain."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/09/immigration.debate/index.html

***

Romney:
Sharpton's comment could be 'bigoted'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney
Wednesday called Rev. Al Sharpton's remarks about Mormonism
"terribly misguided" and said the remark could be considered a
"bigoted comment."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/romney-sharptons-comment-could-be.html

***

GOP leader vows to reassess Iraq surge in
September

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- House Minority
Leader John Boehner, R-Ohio, said Wednesday that when Congress
returns in September, "there will be a reassessment" on how
well the surge of U.S. troops in Iraq is working, and whether
it's time to consider "Plan B."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/gop-leader-vows-to-reassess-iraq-surge.html

***

RNC chair suggests a national primary
day

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The Republican
National Committee's general chairman said Wednesday that he
fears a "free for all" among states fighting for early
presidential primary dates this year and believes his party may
need to consider a single national primary day in the future.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/rnc-chair-suggests-national-primary-day.html

***

Richardson ad: Over-qualified?

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- New Mexico Gov. Bill Richardson is
infusing humor into a new campaign commercial by showing the
presidential candidate in a mock job interview that emphasizes
his credentials.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/richardson-ad-over-qualified.html

***

Anti-war vets group targets GOP moderates

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The anti-war veterans group
VoteVets.org is targeting several Republicans who face tough
reelection contests with a new multi-state TV ad campaign that
launched Wednesday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/anti-war-vets-group-targets-gop.html

***

Romney touts military plans in new ad

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney
is touting his proposal to expand the size and funding of the
U.S. military in new ad airing in Iowa and New Hampshire.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/romney-touts-military-plans-in-new-ad.html

***

Maryland governor endorses Clinton

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Hillary Clinton formally
picked up the endorsement of Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley in
Annapolis Wednesday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/maryland-governor-endorses-clinton.html
